title: Safe neighbourhood
text:
Follow Rozengrct, and you are rewarded with a chilled-out neighbourhood with cheap gym facilities, ex-pat craft shops and nice sidewalk canals, with lots of young friendly people.

On the negative side the hotels are overpriced, as most in the center - so stay more towards vondell park. At least this area is safe from muggers.

title: Very popular cannibis cafe
text:
The atmosphere at the Bulldog Leidseplein is unforgettable. Always young, heaving and atmospheric, usually a lot of tourists's from UK drinking and smoking like the good old days! I've been to Amsterdam 5/6 times and each time I have a good time.

Since I've been old enough to smoke drugs, I come to the bulldog. Last time I brought a few Hash Moroccan pre-rolled! They were wasy to smoke and I smoked outside, will visit again in the future, but there's much more to experience don't waste your visit here put it that way ;P the world is a big place

title: Best beach in the world!
text: Certain you won't find a better beach in Europe! Turkeys med coast is a msut visit once in your life

title: My first experience of a Resort! Loved every minute!
text:
5 star rating! Absolutely brilliant family resort in a beautiful town on the Aegean coast!

Both the Hotel and Location! Just incredible!! - Child-friendly pools, free drinks all day and night, wonderfully cooked food, entertainment, friendly staff, and locals, Activities are the best! - Kayaking, Hand Gliding, The best beaches in the world!, Quad biking in ghost towns!

A great break, the lovely local town, cheap! They even let me eat with my family as I stayed outside the resort, but i had to pay to have dinner there and sit with my parents!

title: Perfectly charming stay - but people stay here to be close tot he airport lol !
text:
The staff very friendly and attractive, food and bar available, airport transfers free of charge also! Perfect!

Might I add, Hungarian comedy shows were very funny! Despite watching them on a very old TV! which you can ignore if your only staying for one night!

It's an adventure getting to this place from the veces ( nearby train station ) walking through the 'charmed shackled' suburban dwellings - before you reach the Hotel! lol

title: Great Double room - Maybe the best in Athens
text:
I was not disappointed with this room - It was the most comfortable I have found in Athens, but not the cheapest! ... The breakfast was the best, very hot and plentiful and better than the other 3 I found on my travels.

I made the trouble of learning the local language that day and found myself having a great time! During my stay, there was a Jevoha's witness conference and the lobby was filled with very nice people.

Also, the other building next door has a swimming pool on the roof, but when I visited it was totally packed with people, it's more of a nice to have feature... because it didn't look very deep! but I can imagine on a sunny day it's perfect to sit outside on the balcony and have a drink from the bar by the pool! Perfect for families, maybe a solo traveller could find somewhere more student-focused

title: Wonderful insight into Netherlands amongst the Sins of the Dam!
text:
The Jewish quarter and Anne franks are Amsterdam cities saving grace. The sensitivity and quality of the tour give you an idea of the real Netherlands.

I purposely walked further afield to see the real people of the country and was pleasantly surprised with the normality, ensure you see the museum, and be sure to leave the inner city and the sins of the city!
place: Amsterdam's Jewish Quarter Small-Group Walking Tour

title: Desperate to avoid the flying pig, i stumbled into this overpriced gem!
text:
For some unknown reason - My school and college, my friend's birthday choices have all resulted in me visiting the dam! So, I decided to backpack here solo backpacking and had a totally different experience!

It is better than the flying pig and the other overpriced, out-dated, and terrible rooms in Amsterdam! but the value is just overly inflated!

title: This is in the redlight district and should only be used in emergencies!
text:
I have stayed here 3 times, once on a birthday weekend, once on a passing visit and again last year!

The area is terrible, your surrounded by basic brits! everyone is either on a stag do, come to sleep with prostitutes, or to smoke weed in one of the many cafes! This is not the real holland or Netherlands and is basically a circus for students on gap years!

Each time I stayed here was because my friends had already booked it and I was too drunk to notice the state of the place ! shame on me

title: Good location and does not look like the pictures!
text:
Accommodation in Amsterdam is always difficult! You either have overpriced rooms of the low quality of trashy backpacking rooms in the center! This was overpriced and I have learned my lesson on my 5th visit to Amsterdam!

Better to stay near Vondel park

title: Great location and high quality room
text:
My credit card was stolen in Barcelona, the day before and I was unable to find a room to stay in. I actually spent the night sat on a subway floor with my bag, until I could call my family the next day to wire me some funds.

The hotel let me charge my phone so I could call my family and I was so thankful for the clean bed and hot shower, so I could visit the Spanish police the following day to cancel my card and report the incident! What a nightmare! but thanks for the charge! A little expensive

title: A cheap private hotel room in London Victoria is a rare comodity!
text: I was surprised to find a room so cheap and close to Victoria, my train destination primarily! Although the room is actually not luxurious as the area would suggest, it is cheap, the walls are very thin, i could hear the people next door talking and it was only slightly better than sleeping on the road! but the location is perfect!

title: A cheap, but friendly backpacker hostel
text:
This is a budget backpacker hostel, but coming from the UK, I found the service friendly. The pub crawl organized was a lot of fun and I met people from all across the world here fashion students from holland, students from Russia, China, Iran, and Australia all having fun together.

Students were all chilled here, even studying on their laptops instead of going to class! This is near all of the great museums and sites too! but it is not luxury or anything special

title: Cheap, Chilled. Modern, Cool for modern backpackers
text:
When I came the pool was closed, but in Summer I'm certain this is a super chilled place to stay. The cost of the room is good and on both occasions - I met really cool and fun backpackers.. A journalist from Holland, A Software designer from Germany, and a Car fabric designer working in India from Bilbao.

Barcelona and Toc, exemplify how affordable and easy it is to visit European cities on the fly to have great experiences

title: Great Backpacker Hostel
text:
This is a good, safe, and backpacking friendly place to 'crash out' and very easy to check-in here!
The bar downstairs is very friendly and welcoming also! You know what you are getting from St.christopher's around Europe!

title: A good base when in Rio!
text:
This hotel is in Lapa! So you are close to many pubs, clubs, tours, and sites.
You are minutes from 2 subway stations and if you want a late-night drink the area is open till very late (5 am, just be careful from the drunk people )
I recall the room was fine from memory, the staff was very helpful and the breakfast was fantastic!
Every morning I would use the gym and go for a quick swim at 7 am in the 30-degree heat!
The view is nothing special, but it was great value for money and I would highly recommend it!
If I visited Rio again, I would want a more beach-based holiday, and I'm certain I could find a similar quality hotel on Leblon with views of the beach, and higher quality nighlife

title: Good Starting point for Athens travel
text: I stayed here and there were many students staying here ( Which is a good sign.) I recall the breakfast bar upstairs has great views and the food was basic but nice. There's also a gym and overall was reasonable for the amenities it offered. One negative point however, is that the area is very run down and during my visit to greece, I found many beggers around this area which was not desiable.

title: Quintessential Athens viewing
text:
My father lived in Athens for 2 months back in the 70s and I was interested to visit the country first hand myself. I found my first visit spell-binding, very unique and grand, but the temple of the gods was derelict. What was obvious when I went there was the country was falling apart. Lots of grand old buildings graffitied with political slogans

My perspective of Greece was always a Euro football win in circa 2002, and bearded philosophical artistic people, like the ones I met on my degree, so was keen to meet the greeks in there own country.

The country much like downtown Rome has remanence of Byzantine empires and a legacy of greatness which was in the center of the greek people. I was fascinated by the things id heard from the city and went to the Acropolis on the second day.

How will the Plato book I received make sense, compared to the architecture - or the mythology I studied as a child? I was not disappointed this was the place the wrestlers, the gladiators, and the fighters.

It is an iron age fort, a palace to the kings and homer once spoke about this in nietczhes 'birth of tragedy', built to defend the royalty from invaders, it has strong pillars made from stone, a grand entrance and is very high up.

title: Late Night Hangout
text: I visited the Nikel Bar late night on Saturday and was pleasantly surprised. I arrived at circa 1 pm and drank 2 small beers with Bar snacks at a reasonable price for the time of night and size of the venue in Central London. Despite being alone i was able to have a welcomed, spacious and lovely wait at a very late hour.

title: Backpacker's Delight
text: The overall hospitality in the hostel matches the 'Backpacking' experience, I have grown to love in the rest of Europe - its cheap, clean, safe, good staff, friendly guests who all wanted to experience Lisborn and see the sites, bars etc...

title: Amazing Hostel with a Mediterranean feel
text: The Hostel has a communal Kitchen and Living Quater's, with Bookshelf and Patio area. I shared a 4 bed room with a lovely group from Canada and we all found the Hostel, very welcoming and were able to be at home, Completley something very rare in hostel jumping! Great find :)

title: A Remarkable & Wonderful Building, with the addition of a new viewing platform
text: The Tate's New annexed Architecture is a Remarkable extension to the original Turbine hall. On this occasion, the tenth floor was wonderful and exciting experience to enjoy, after viewing the main Exhibition you can relax with a drink and enjoy the London Skyline

title: Last minute Date Night (Unimpressed!)
text: You do not have to book this resturant even on a busy Saturday evening. It is based in Central London (Knightbridge) - The venue is not very romantic and the food is very expensive. I did not enjoy the atmosphere because of this and would not recommend eating her unless you have no other choice.

title: Great Date Night
text: I visited Skybar and was impressed by the Indoor plant's and General Atmosphere. I visited with a date and we enjoyed the view(s) of the city. On a saturday the clientale is a broad mix of people and we had a great time once the DJ started playing.

title: Impress your Guests with a drink in this Hotel
text: The Hotel has a wonderful luxurious and beautiful interior with a selection of Area's to lounge or impress a guest(s). I was impressed by the atmosphere, service and location which is a stone's throw from the River, Embankment bridge and tube station. Perfect for a Great impression

title: Sushi Fine Dining for Begginer's
text: If you are a beginner, Sushi can be difficult to master or understand. Raw Fish needs to be cooked in large portion's otherwise the fish will go off and expire. You need to be aware of the portion sizes, which are not always obvious. My date an expert in Japanese cuisine did not explain, how I should order - therefore I ordered too much

title: My Favourite Bar in London
text: This Bar is great to impress guests with your knowledge of drinks and cocktail. The whiskey menu is very impressive.
